{include "affiliate_loader"} A conversation with JaTaune Bosby of ACLU of Alabama and Andrea Young of ACLU of Georgia. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

This year we have seen unprecedented voter engagement nationwide and across the South. Despite the consistent challenges of voter disenfranchisement in our state, we understand that to increase our impact and work towards fair and equitable elections, we must work collectively and utilize the momentum at this moment to help us set the path forward to build power over the next decade.

In this conversation, we will discuss the tactics and strategies that have elevated the state of Georgia over the last several years and what is guiding them as the state prepares for a historic senate election on January 5.

Building Power in the South:
A Conversation with JaTaune Bosby and Andrea Young, ACLU-GA

Wednesday, December 16, 3 – 4 p.m.
Online
RSVP Today

Please note: This link will take you to a third-party website, zoom.us.

Just as we saw abortion bans mirrored in states across the South in 2019, Alabama and Georgia share a collective past of fighting the same battles and against similarly conservative state attitudes, from slavery to the Jim Crow era to today.

Following Georgia's example, there is an opportunity to begin building strength in Alabama and across the South, leading to groundbreaking changes and power shifts that can shape a new Southern landscape.

Topics of discussion:

  • What's currently happening in Georgia.
  • How the momentum of now is leading the Georgia Special Election.
  • How we begin to build power in the South.

If you can attend this conversation, RSVP today.

Don't forget to save the date on your calendar.
